criteria: Knowledge of Labor Union History and Procedures
Analysis of the Effects of Unionization, Minimum Wage, and Unemployment Insurance
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of labor market operations or related concepts.
Shows a minimal understanding of labor market operations; struggles to define key terms.
Identifies basic elements of labor market operations but lacks depth in explanation.
Explains labor market operations with some accuracy, including basic union functions and minimum wage.
Demonstrates a solid understanding of labor market operations, including union procedures and effects of minimum wage and unemployment insurance.
Demonstrates a comprehensive and insightful understanding of labor market operations, including nuanced aspects of unions, minimum wage, and unemployment insurance, with real-world examples.
Shows no awareness of the history or procedures of American labor unions.
Has a vague awareness of labor unions but cannot describe their history or procedures.
Identifies a few major American labor unions but struggles to explain their establishment or procedures.
Describes the establishment of some principal American labor unions and their basic procedures for gaining benefits.
Explains the history and procedures of American labor unions in detail, including negotiation tactics and benefits gained.
Provides an in-depth analysis of the history and procedures of American labor unions, including their impact on workers' rights and the economy.
Unable to identify any effects of unionization, minimum wage, or unemployment insurance.
Lists one or two superficial effects of unionization, minimum wage, or unemployment insurance.
Describes some basic effects of unionization, minimum wage, and unemployment insurance but lacks analytical depth.
Analyzes the effects of unionization, minimum wage, and unemployment insurance with some accuracy, including both positive and negative impacts.
Provides a thorough analysis of the effects of unionization, minimum wage, and unemployment insurance, considering various perspectives and stakeholders.
Offers a sophisticated and well-supported analysis of the complex effects of unionization, minimum wage, and unemployment insurance, demonstrating critical thinking and nuanced understanding.
